title: Firefox is acting generally slow, choppy, and laggy, especially when playing Youtube videos.
content: The problem (Firefox being slow) happens within the confines of Troubleshoot Mode, I have already attempted a restart as well as clearing all temporary cached files and pages to no avail. While I did manage to make it better through setting my proxy settings to 'No Proxy', Firefox still seems to be running at a slower pace than even the dreaded Chrome. Youtube is the worst offender, with videos that used to run smoothly in Chrome now lagging, buffering, and moving so slow that Youtube is forced to automatically reduce the video quality (however, I should note that even on 360p do I encounter a large amount of slowness). Please note that I am a total dummy when it comes to technical stuff, so I will most likely need extensive and comprehensive instructions on ways to solve/diagnose this issue. I thank anyone who's willing to help me with this, it's the only thing that Firefox is worse at in comparison with Chrome.

title: 500 Server Error
content:
Yesterday I synced Firefox desktop to iPhone 13 and iPad 11. I created an account. The syncing worked.

Today I tried to access one specific website and got this message: "500 server error. Oops. Sorry. Your request could not be carried out because of an error. Please log out and sign in again". That didn't work.

I tried accessing other websites within Firefox desktop Version # 140.04 64 bit. They do work.

I don't know if this service error is something within Firefox or within Windows 10 latest update, or something else. I've reviewed system Administrative Events and there are numerous notes for 7/18/25. Many say "Distributed COM" some are Service control manager, many entries "Device setup manager". I have photos of several screens.

I've deleted cache and history (I use private Mozilla). I've restarted the laptop PC twice. No change to that website access. I used troubleshooting and that didn't help at all.

Please help diagnose where the problem is and how to fix it if the source is my computer. If it's a server problem please advise. Thank you. JHL
creator: jhloeb28

title: How do I restore a previous browser session, when the button has disappeared?
content: Hallo. I was trying to attend a Zoom meeting and, for some reason, rather than opening Zoom, it opened Firefox before I was ready. After the meeting, I closed the windows which I didn't need, before attempting to restart my original session. Unbeknownst to me, I had closed the window with the "restore previous session" button on it and I can't seem to find a way to restart that session. Can anybody help? The only option which I can think of involves backing up the entire computer, thus losing all other work that I have done since that backup was made. I can't see 3 lines and when I go to the 3 dots, the history doesn't have an option to restore the session from there. I am using Chrome (Nearly up to date! Relaunch Chrome to finish updating. Version 137.0.7151.120 (Official Build) (arm64)) I have yet to finish updating and I am using Mac OS Sequoia 15.1 I am a HEAVY user and had hundreds of windows and tabs, which I was in process of cataloguing, having restored the original session from my old computer, which was stolen, recently so, this is the last thing that I need. title: macOS Mission Control - selecting a window that's behind Firefox
content:
On macOS (Sonoma for me), if a Firefox window has focus and and there is a window that doesn't have a dock icon (for example, the "About This Mac" window) that is behind the Firefox window, using Mission Control to bring that window to the front doesn't work.

Well, actually it does work, but then the Firefox window immediately comes back to the front. If any other app has the focus, then it works correctly (Firefox doesn't force its way back to the front).

Does anyone else experience this, or is it just my system?

title: playback of DRM content
content:
no matter what I try I cannot get any content from HBO max, crunchyroll, or spotify to play. I feel as though I have tried every troublshooting step. In firefox 140.0.4 64 bit on windows 10 I have:

-turned DRM off and on -disabled and re-enabled widevine -disabling all extensions -try in a private tab -turning off tracking protection -clearing cookies/cache/site data -uninstalling and reinstalling firefox -trying on firefox nightly -trying on other firefox based browsers zen, librefox same issue. chromium based browsers and firefox on my windows 11 laptop play drm content like normal -manually installing older version of widevine -changing useragent to chrome(this triggered cloudflare and would not let me pass) -making another user in windows and trying there

the error i get on crunchyroll is code: DRM-0 and on spotify it loads but the play icon does nothing. in hbo max i get error code 1k-0003

At this point I don't know what else to try, If there is not another solution I probably try to just switch to brave browser or wiping this pc and reinstalling windows.

title: Saved tab groups disappeared
content:
Hello,

I'm writing because I’ve encountered an issue with the tab groups feature in Firefox.

Some time ago, after a browser update, I noticed a new feature that allowed me to group tabs thematically — I could name each group (e.g., "Study", "Work"), choose a color for it, and save and close groups to reopen them later. I found it very useful and used it a lot.

Last night, I decided to declutter my browser and closed several tab groups using the built-in menu. A bit later, I shut down my computer, but perhaps too quickly. This morning, when I turned my computer back on, Firefox was very slow to start. After a restart, everything seemed to work fine again, and the open tabs were restored.

However, all my previously saved (but temporarily closed) tab groups disappeared. In the tab group menu, I can now only see the ones currently open. I’ve searched through all the settings and history but cannot find any way to restore the missing groups.

Is there any way to recover the tab groups that I had previously saved and closed?

Thank you very much in advance!
creator: atmosferna

title: Recovery Key Question
content: This may seem like a dumb question, but I have never used a recovery key before, and I am not sure it is worth having one. To me it just seems like a secondary password, in case someone can't locate their first password. Well, if you are the kind of person who loses and forgets passwords, won't you lose and forget recovery keys also? I recently added one, but honestly I don't see why it makes me more secure, since I store it in the same place as my password. Should we be storing passwords and security keys in different places?

title: Microphone Not Working in KOOK Web on Firefox
content:
Dear KOOK Support Team,

I'm encountering an issue with microphone access in the KOOK web voice channels when using Firefox desktop. Despite enabling all necessary permissions—system-level microphone access, and relevant Firefox settings like `media.peerconnection.enabled`—my microphone does not work. It works fine with other WebRTC sites, and the same KOOK page works perfectly in Chrome and Edge.

This suggests a potential compatibility issue of KOOK’s web voice feature with Firefox.

Could you please: 1. Provide any guidance or settings to enable Firefox compatibility? 2. Let me know if there are plans to improve Firefox support in future updates?

Looking forward to your response. Thank you!
